title.native: 花右京メイド隊 La Verite

description:
After his mother passes away, Taro Hanaukyo is invited to his grandfather's home. There, he meets a beautiful maid named Mariel and finds out that his grandfather has retired to a remote island and has given him ownership of his estate. Taro also discovers that not only is the estate a colossal mansion, it has hundreds of gorgeous maids ready to serve him 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

name.native: シンシア ランドラヴィジァ

node.description:
__Height:__ 162 cm

[Profile](http://office-anemone.com/mt-search.cgi?IncludeBlogs=4,5&tag=%e7%94%b0%e4%b8%ad%e7%90%86%e6%81%b5) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/rie-tanaka/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tanakarie) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCACBeSOH0iA0L2okeeigy5A/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rie_Tanaka) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%94%B0%E4%B8%AD%E7%90%86%E6%81%B5_(%E5%A3%B0%E5%84%AA) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rieanesan/) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@rieane3)

- She has starred in several anime series with [Megumi Toyoguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/95144/) in which their characters are part of the same teams.
- Rie's widely known favourite greeting sign is the V sign whenever she stands in front of a camera.
- She is a member of the Steel Angels, a singing trio composed of the three lead seiyuu of Steel Angel Kurumi--[Atsuko Enomoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95411/) and [Masayo Kurata](https://anilist.co/staff/95616/) included, and is responsible for its opening and end themes.
- Married to fellow voice actor [Koichi Yamadera](https://anilist.co/staff/95011) from 2012 to 2018.

**Non anime roles:**
- [Himeko Murata](https://anilist.co/character/142944/Himeko-Murata) - Honkai Impact (Video Game), Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- [Lisa](https://anilist.co/character/190867/Lisa/) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Valeriede - Memento Mori (VG)
- Kan-E-Senna - Final Fantasy XIV (VG)
- Isabel - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Queen Dahlia - Tevi (VG)
- Queen Tahlia - Tevi (VG)
- Sweetheart - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Joanna Calendula - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kadomaita) | [Youtube](https://youtube.com/@maitach?si=xA-RVZlZtLD2PQ4Q) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@maita_ayuta.ch)

**Non anime roles:**
- [Yaoyao] - Genshin Impact (Video Game)

[Website](http://www.michiru-oshima.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/OshimaMichiru) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6zqZlqpjrq3op255dF32Fr?autoplay=true)

She is a composer who has worked on several video game, movie, and television titles. Her works include composition for the video games Ico for PlayStation 2, Arc the Lad III, and an orchestral arrangement of a Zelda medley for the Wii and Gamecube game The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess. In addition to video game music, she has composed music for the Godzilla movies and scores for numerous anime television series, including Fullmetal Alchemist (and the motion picure Fullmetal Alchemist the Movie: Conqueror of Shamballa), Queen Emeraldas and Bounen no Xamdou. She was also the composer for a Japanese stage musical adaptation of the classic Hollywood film Roman Holiday.

Ooshima graduated from the Kunitachi College of Music, Department of Music Composition. Afterwards she began her activities as a composer and arranger while in college, and has been involved in making music for movies, commercials, TV programs, animated features, and ambient music. While in college, she released a symphony entitled "Orasho". Through her masterful manipulation of both orchestras and synthesizers, she has attracted attention from various sectors for creating grandiose, dramatic sounds and beautiful melodies. Her awards include the Mainichi Film Contest Award for Best Music, and the 21st, 24th, 26th, 27th, 29th and 30th Japanese Academy Award for Music, and Jackson Hole Film Festival 2007(USA) Best Composer Award.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cunepero)**

Kojima got started in the industry one day while he was working as a freelancer in various industries and somehow ended up with a job in anime at the age of 23.

His first project was on the show "[Shima Shima Tora no Shimajirou](https://anilist.co/anime/9768/Shima-Shima-Tora-no-Shimajirou/)" under [Studio Kikan](https://anilist.co/studio/256/Studio-Kikan), where he got started of by doing in-between animation. At the time he was very unexperienced with anime production and has [said](https://www.arabnews.jp/article/arts-culture/article_26145/) he likely would have been fired for his lack of knowledge and poor quality work, if not for the in-between animation checker teaching him everything from scratch.

Later down the line after establishing himself more in the anime industry, he would go on to work on "[Gurren Lagann](https://anilist.co/anime/2001/Tengen-Toppa-Gurren-Lagann/)" as a challenge to himself, where he would put forth mecha and effects animation he had no idea how to prior.

Kojima [states](https://www.arabnews.jp/article/arts-culture/article_26145/) he feels a lot of inspiration from manga artists who are able to think about a story, break it up into panels, and express it in pictures. He has thought about drawing a manga himself, even if it's something simple.

Some of his favorite anime are "[Inital D](https://anilist.co/anime/185/Initial-D/)," "[Natsume's Book of Friends](https://anilist.co/anime/4081/Natsume-Yuujinchou/)," "[Re:ZERO -Starting Life in Another World-](https://anilist.co/anime/21355/ReZero-kara-Hajimeru-Isekai-Seikatsu/)," "[Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Shin-Seiki-Evangelion/)," "[A KITE](https://anilist.co/anime/320/A-KITE/)," "[JIN-ROH](https://anilist.co/anime/570/JINROH/)," "[FLCL](https://anilist.co/anime/227/FLCL/)" and "[Doukyuusei -Classmates-](https://anilist.co/anime/21096/Doukyuusei/)."

Some of his favorite manga are "[HI Score Girl](https://anilist.co/manga/74501/Hi-Score-Girl/)" and "[A White Rose in Bloom](https://anilist.co/manga/108360/Mejirobana-no-Saku/)."

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/midorihatoneko) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/i/user/286739197)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [older animator](https://anilist.co/staff/250761/) by the same name._
__Hiromi Kikuta__ is a Japanese sound director, who works for the company Rakuonsha.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/xexex36) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yoshihiro_watanabe1971/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/渡邊義弘_(アニメーター%29)

An animator, character designer and adult game artist.

_Not to be confused with the producer [of the same name.](https://anilist.co/staff/233840)_
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/828502878721421314)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/野中卓也)

Originating from Studio Wombat. He has been affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/) since its establishment.

Born in Tokyo and raised in Yokohama, Kanagawa Prefecture, he discovered his passion for anime during middle school, inspired by classics like [Galaxy Express 999](https://anilist.co/anime/1491/Galaxy-Express-999/) and [Lupin III: The Castle of Cagliostro](https://anilist.co/anime/1430/Lupin-The-3rd-The-Castle-of-Cagliostro/). It was in high school that he met a like-minded friend with a love for drawing, sparking his aspiration to become an animator. During those formative years, he actively participated in the art club, where he honed his skills and embarked on creating independent anime projects.

After graduating from the Yoyogi Animation Academy, he joined Studio Wombat as an in-between animator. During his time at the Yoyogi Animation Academy, he shared the same class with notable contemporaries such as [Mitsuru Obunai](https://anilist.co/staff/103077/Mitsuru-Obunai), [Yutaka Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/101801/Yutaka-Nakamura), and [Junichi Fujisaku](https://anilist.co/staff/100423/Junichi-Fujisaku). His journey took a significant turn in 1999 when he played a pivotal role in the establishment of [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/ufotable). Gathering with visionaries like [Hikaru Kondou](https://anilist.co/staff/103076/Hikaru-Kondou) in an old apartment in North Ikebukuro, Tokyo, they laid the foundation for what would become a renowned animation studio. In 2009, he made a significant move to the newly opened ufotable Tokushima Studio, where he assumed a leadership role, overseeing and nurturing a team primarily composed of young talents.

Originally harboring aspirations of becoming a director, he navigated a path from being an animator to realizing his dream. Armed with experiences in key animation and directing, he marked his directorial debut with "Hanaukyo Maid Team: La Verite." Following his move to ufotable Tokushima Studio, he assumed the position of chief of the directing department, leaving his mark on numerous episodes. In his directorial role, he approached each project with careful consideration, assigning cuts to the Tokushima Studio staff thoughtfully, illustrating his dedication and meticulous approach to his craft.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/野中卓也)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高村和宏)

A freelance animator formerly part of [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). Debuted on the 14th episode of [Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the other [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/223351/) with the exact same name._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/193795545)

Originating from [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).
[Twitter](http://twitter.com/i/user/128364216)

[Takaaki Chiba](https://anilist.co/staff/147856/)'s brother.

title.native: 花右京メイド隊 La Verite
金装のヴェルメイユ～崖っぷち魔術師は最強の厄災と魔法世界を突き進む～
